title: INFLUENCE OF DRUG-POLYMER INTERACTIONS ON RELEASE KINETICS OF PLGA AND PLA/PEG NPS

authors.name: Merve Gul
affiliations: Department of Drug Sciences, University of Pavia

authors.name: Ida Genta
affiliations: Department of Chemical Engineering, Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya (UPC-EEBE)

authors.name: Maria M. Perez Madrigal
affiliations: Barcelona Research Center for Multiscale Science and Engineering, EEBE, Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya

authors.name: Carlos Aleman
affiliations: Barcelona Research Center for Multiscale Science and Engineering, EEBE, Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya

authors.name: Enrica Chiesa
affiliations: Barcelona Research Center for Multiscale Science and Engineering, EEBE, Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya

summary: The study investigates the influence of drug-polymer interactions on the release kinetics of PLGA and PLA/PEG nanoparticles (NPs) in vitro.
methods: The study used a microfluidic chip to synthesize NPs and micelles, and then loaded CURC into the NPs. The release kinetics of CURC from the NPs and micelles were measured over time.
results: {'1.Physical Properties of NPs': 'NPs had uniform size distribution with PDI ≤ 0.2, consistent with TEM observations.', '2.Release Kinetics of NPs': 'CURC-loaded NPs had a slower release rate compared to CURC-loaded micelles.', '3.Cytotoxicity & Antimicrobial Activity': 'CURC-loaded NPs showed better antimicrobial activity compared to CURC-loaded micelles.'}
funding_sources: European Union's research and innovation programme under the Marie Skłodowska-Curie grant agreement No 101072645
